page.title: 14Shopping
page.content: There are 9 shops in Chew Magna. Walkers Stores, at the top of the village, is a small, friendly family business selling groceries. The Mace and the Co-op are small supermarkets. They are at the bottom of the High Street in the centre of the village. Mr. Pearce has a butcher's shop. The Post Office, an attractive stone-fronted building, doesn't just post parcels. It sells baby things, cosmetics, greetings cards and in winter it opens up a room which sells Christmas things. Just across the road there used to be an Old Bakehouse but now it is a children's boutique called Small Talk. Wellington Gallery is a newsagents which also sells ornaments, pictures and lampshades. Fitzgerald's sells things for the home as well as wool and some clothes. West Midland Farmers sells farming goods.
